messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Files containing the handler implementation referenced by routes/api.php (App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostController@update):

- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php

Explanation and steps I took
- routes/api.php registers Route::apiResource('posts', PostController::class)->only(['update', 'store', 'destroy']) under the Api\V1 namespace, so the controller is App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostController.
- I searched the codebase for PostController definitions and found controllers in several locations; the API v1 controller is at app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php.
- I opened that file and confirmed it contains the update method with signature:
  public function update(PostsRequest $request, Post $post): PostResource
  which performs authorization, updates the Post model with the validated fields, and returns a PostResource.
- There are other PostController classes (e.g. app/Http/Controllers/PostController.php and app/Http/Controllers/Admin/PostController.php) but they are in different namespaces and are not the controller bound to the API route you pointed out.

files.description: List of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations.
